cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the central Louisiana coast Monday, then forecast to turn west and track very close to the Louisiana shoreline and along the upper Texas coast through Tuesday night–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-southeast Louisiana coast (near Morgan City to Grand Isle)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No active tropical storm or hurricane watches west of Intracoastal City LA; all watches for the Texas coast discontinued
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City LA eastward to the MS/AL border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northeast and north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward; secondary impacts spreading westward along the Louisiana and upper Texas shoreline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated pockets could exceed 4 inches, but widespread totals closer to 2-4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (primary surge focus is east of Texas, 2–4 ft confined to LA/MS coastline)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds only 16%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water‐level rises under 2 ft possible with onshore flow, but significant surge impacts not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday–Wednesday could total 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts, producing brief urban/low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and dangerous rip currents along upper Texas coast through mid-week
